thread.title: Tracy Morgan coming back to Delaware after crash

title: Tracy Morgan coming back to Delaware after crash
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Tracy Morgan coming back to Delaware after crash Sixteen months after comedian Tracy Morgan was critically injured in a car accident returning home from a Delaware show, the "Saturday Night Live" favorite is coming back to The First State. Post to Facebook Tracy Morgan coming back to Delaware after crash Sixteen months after comedian Tracy Morgan was critically injured in a car accident returning home from a Delaware show, the "Saturday Night Live" favorite is coming back to The First State. Check out this story on delawareonline.com: http://delonline.us/1RU7HBC Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation Pulp Culture Ryan Cormier , The News Journal 1:20 p.m. EDT October 20, 2015 
Comedian Tracy Morgan will return to Delaware this winter -- more than a year after being critically injured in a car accident. (Photo: Dana Edelson/NBC) 
Sixteen months after comedian Tracy Morgan was critically injured in a car accident returning home from a Delaware show, the "Saturday Night Live" favorite is coming back to The First State. 
Morgan , who returned to host "Saturday Night Live" last weekend, will perform at The Playhouse on Rodney Square (1007 North Market St., Wilmington) on March 11 at 8 p.m. 
Tickets, which cost $46-55, go on sale Friday at 10 a.m. via The Playhouse's box office, calling 888-0200 or going to duponttheatre.com . 
Morgan was traveling home June 7, 2014, on the New Jersey Turnpike following a show at the Dover Downs Hotel & Casino when the limo bus he was riding in was struck by a tractor-trailer . 
Morgan spent more than a month in the hospital and a rehabilitation clinic recovering from his injuries, which included a broken leg, nose and ribs. Fellow comedian James "Jimmy Mack" McNair died in the crash. 
A year before the crash, Morgan headlined at the The Playhouse on Rodney Square , known then as the Dupont Theatre. 
To preview the show, he spoke to The News Journal , saying, "I enjoy doing show business. I can’t pick one genre. I love all of it. If God gives me enough time, I’ll do it all. I want to do Broadway. I want to direct a movie. It’s all about the experience." 
Contact Ryan Cormier of The News Journal at rcormier@delawareonline.com or (302) 324-2863. Follow him on Facebook ( @ryancormier ), Twitter ( @ryancormier ) and Instagram ( @ryancormier ). Read or Share this story: http://delonline.us/1RU7HBC Most Popular
